name: CheckIn
text message: How are you doing with giving your child or teen instructions?

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: Great to hear it went well, you are a star!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!

name: CheckIn
option 1: My child or teen did not want to follow the instruction
option 2: I gave a negative instead of a positive instruction
option 3: I gave too many instructions at once
option 4: My child or teen could not do what I asked them
option 5: I forgot to praise my child or teen for following my instruction

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: I know, our children need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient, try again, and remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction!

name: CheckIn
text message: I know, it takes some time to get used to giving positive instructions – it’s really worth trying again! Think about behaviour you would love to see your teen do more, and think of positive ways to give that instruction!

name: CheckIn
text message: I know, it is hard to remember to give one instruction at a time. When we do it, our child is more likely to listen – so we can praise them even more!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sometimes we just expect our children to do what we want them. But when we praise them for it, they feel encouraged to listen again next time!

name: CheckIn
text message: It is hard to remember to give realistic instructions. Try to make sure that your child or teen can physically do what you want them to do. Be specific!
